intro: Hieracium kozlowskyanum, commonly known as Kozlowski's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, exhibiting a rosette of basal leaves. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the genus Hieracium. It is noted for its adaptability to various environmental conditions and has been studied for potential horticultural and ecological applications.
